website_summaries.verdict: A great computer fan for gaming computers that require better airflow without liquid cooling.
pros: Extremely silent for better noise control during normal use
Uses high-quality plastics to last longer than other fan options
Easy to install in most computer cases
cons: Only comes with a three pin connector

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Fast
customer_reviews.text: The LED is really bright on this one. At least compared to the other fans currently surrounding it. Easy install, it came with a molex adapter. The fan is significantly louder than my others in the case, but it's not bothering me. The other fans have speed control and are set to lowest setting, as for this one just spins at its default speed. This was an emergency purchase so I didn't attempt to purchase oem case fans. But seeing the difference in brightness and speed, I might purchase two more to finish out the case set up.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not silent, high pitch hum at full speed
customer_reviews.text: This fan has a high hum at full speed (2000 RPM), so I returned it and opted for the ARCTIC F12 Silent in it's place, since it truly is silent. One note, I purchased the Kingwin 5 Channel Multi-Fan Controller with Individual LED FPX-005, and this was the one fan in 3 different models that properly scaled with the varying speed settings--so If you need fans controlled by this controller, this one should do the trick. When this fan was down at the lower RPMs, it was very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Loud First, Then Louder
customer_reviews.text: Pretty loud when I first installed it, but it was better than the grinding sound coming from my old case fan. That didn't last long. For years now I've put up with a loud grinding sound that goes away a few minutes after my computer boots up (though the fan is still loud). Then last night, the grinding noise became permanent. The fan isn't designed so it can be opened up, so I can't get even try to lubricate it. Of course, it could very well be shot bearings, anyway. Either way, I can't fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Corndog

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet fan with excellent airflow.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the case fan on my PC. Cooler master is a trusted brand but not all of their products always hit the mark. I had read reviews that the sickle shape of the fan blade improves performance while decreasing noise. To my surprise, this did exactly that and exceed my expectations. The fan is much quieter than the previous non-sickle blade and airflow is obviously much improved. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Phineas J Whoopee

customer_reviews.title: I replaced a factory 120mm fan with this guy. ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a factory 120mm fan in a Cooler Master 431plus case, with this guy. This fan was a lot noisier. It might have moved a lot more air causing the noise. I connected it straight to a Molex connecter using the supplied adaptor. I installed the first one and let it run for several weeks to see if it would quiet down. It didn't. I replaced it with the 2nd fan and the 2nd fan was just a noisy. I will probably return it. But be advised neither one of my 2 fans are silent. Nor are they as quiet as the factory fan. Really disappointed. Ron
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended Unless Your PC Is In Another Room
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One is fairly loud, but tolerable, and works. The other is so loud due to vibration that it's unusable. I tried dampening the vibration by putting some foam between the center of the fan and the case grill and zip-tying the crossbars of the fan to the case grill, but it didn't make the fan quiet enough to use. It was like having a dentist's drill running the entire time the PC was on. Unfortunately, there are no returns on this item.
customer_reviews.author: linux4me

customer_reviews.title: Working as Intended
customer_reviews.text: The fan /Sounds/ and looks to be working. Except the sound is the only comment. It is a notable fan. But not bad. My original fan was basically invisible in sound. This fan is very obvious specially when it changes fan speeds. Its not a big deal, not very lound, but enough to notice which fan is making the noise. Overall its intended use is fufilled and the fan functions as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Green

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a V8 cooler fan, this works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the cpu fan on my brothers V8 cooler. Fan is great but you need to remove the V8 cooler from the MB to do it... due to the screw location i had to remove the MB from the case to change this fan. Lucky for me i google it and saw this was going to be the case, i was aware of it before i bought it.
customer_reviews.author: I am quite picky

customer_reviews.title: Good fans but loud!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fans. They move air well, but man they are LOUD. I am still trying to mess with my motherboard settings to see if I can make them run slower when I'm not pushing the system, but so far I haven't found the right settings. 2 of the 3 I installed keep rotating at about 1800-1900 RPM. Still, keeping the case and CPU nice and cool with the aid of a 200mm front intake fan. I have these 3 positioned at back and top of case for exhaust, as well as on my Hyper212 CPU cooler (replaced the original fan because it was old and only a matter of time, right?)
customer_reviews.author: Mr./Mrs. B.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet...at first
customer_reviews.text: Thought they looked great. Very quiet, too...until now. Three months later, I'm playing a game, loudly...with headphones, when it finally occurred to me I heard what sounded like snoring, which our little dog does quite a lot. When I looked I found her sound asleep, but not a peep from her and yet I still heard it. Then I thought it was frogs outside. Then I finally narrowed it down. I bought two of these to mount at the top of my case and one of them was the culprit. I didn't read the reviews before, but did note it had a 4/5 rating so I got them. Now I see that others are experiencing what I am.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Olive

customer_reviews.title: Lots of airflow and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this very model for 6 years now. It's proven to be reliable, quiet enough, and strong. Unlike most 120mm fans, this one pumps out a lot of air, consuming 4watts vs slower 120mm fans using only 1watt. Pros: Huge amounts of air. Quiet for how much airflow you get. Reliable. Cons: Higher power consumption than slower fans (+3watts). Louder. If you want high airflow without much noise, this fan is it.
customer_reviews.author: ALX

customer_reviews.title: no 3pin to 4pin adapter included
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing cooler master fan that has 4 pin connector that provides fan speed to the main board. This came with 3 pin and when connected with just 3 pins the main board shows no speed measurements. The description is not true and the adapter is not for 4 pin but for connection directly to power supply. Now the only way to see if fan is working is looking at the CPU temperature. NOT RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: P. Ziobrzynski

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat like a drone copter blade for noise level.
customer_reviews.text: NOT "silent". Very loud. I installed this as a replacement case fan and was really disappointed with how loud it was. I went through Cooler Master's painless RMA process and they shipped me another in case the first was defective. The replacement is not quite as loud as the first one but still way too loud for my tastes. Raising my initial 1 star review to a 3 star review because of Cooler Master making the replacement/RMA process so easy.
customer_reviews.author: RAD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in performance
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of CFM this unit claims to move it is terrible. They are quiet....almost like they're not running and it almost feels like they're not running based on airflow. I replaced an older unit with two of these that mounted on the back of my RV fridge for cooling the condenser. Once I wired them and tested the output I was better off leaving the single unit....THAT BLOWS AS MUCH AS BOTH OF THESE COMBINED!
customer_reviews.author: JLV

customer_reviews.title: Fan is great.  Good air flow
customer_reviews.text: The fan packaging looked like it had been stored in some attic somewhere. The packaging was nasty, dusty, roughed up and looked like it was returned even though it technically wasn't opened. So far the fan seems to work OK but instinctively had my doubts as to how this fan was handled previously based on the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: TFord

customer_reviews.title: Great fan !
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fan back in 2013 to replace an old fan that came with the case. It was just making way to much noise. A little over two years later this fan is still going strong. I don't hear any noise coming from the bearings that you normally hear after the bearings start going out. This is not the quietest thing out there but its also not the loudest. The LED still works. It blows a pretty good amount of air still as well. For the price its definitely a good buy, plus there are different colors you can get.
customer_reviews.author: RCod

customer_reviews.title: Great fan tho.
customer_reviews.text: It works great, it does its just and looks cool doing it. I needed to buy a new fan since the bearing on my old fan was wearing out causing the fan to scrape against the plastic grill which mad things loud. I could have bought a regular fan (no-LED) but I noticed for a similar price I could get one with and LED. At first it looked cool it was non-obtrusive, it wasn't too bright and it wasn't too dim where you could not notice if it was lit up or not. I recently bought a soundcard with red LEDs and they just overpower the blue LED so I cant see it anymore : (. Great fan tho.
customer_reviews.author: axsolorz

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Whine... Replaced Immediately
customer_reviews.text: The fan was installed in my son's computer in his bedroom. I could hear an annoying whine emanating from it all the way in my bedroom down the hall. Needless to say it was replaced with another unit from Amazon (B07NDM2VNS) that was perfectly quiet and $2 cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: American Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works great at 1700 RPM
customer_reviews.text: So seems like the operating speed is 1700 RPM and you can spike it up higher if needed. I noticed an immediate difference between the "stock" fans I had which ran at 1300 RPM. With those installed in a push/pull config I was seeing temps peaking at 95 degrees which were causing issues. Now I dont spike above 80 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: John Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier with this product
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with this product. I bought two, one that pushes air in my case, and another pulling it out. Using speed fan, my case went from all sensors showing too hot, to almost all sensors constantly showing good. These do the job and while I hear them, they are not at all what I would consider to be outside of the normal range of fan volume.
customer_reviews.author: Arakinas

customer_reviews.title: Short lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: it is was good fan with enough air flow. here is my 7 fans' story. pro #1 : price is not bad. pro #2 : enough air flow less noisy than similar fans. con #1 : 5 of 7 have LED problem. LED lights were dead. con #2 : 2 of 7 were dead. no more spinning blades. con #3 : 2 of last 5 have vibrating so bad and getting worse and worse.guess they will stop soon. con #4 : returning is not eligible for this item.
customer_reviews.author: aneoaosj

customer_reviews.title: Great value and no LEDs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my stock computer fans. I have a CM Stryker case with two front fans that had blue LEDs. Normally I don't mind LEDs, but with the way the case's fan controller works, both the fan speed and the LED power are increased/decreased together. This means if my fans aren't running at full-speed the LEDs flicker proportionally to the power reduction. Needless to say, it was an annoyance I didn't want to deal with. These get the job done perfectly and come with some decent air flow ratings from the reviews I read. Overall I'm very happy with my purchase and recommend these to anyone who outgrew their LED case fans.
customer_reviews.author: John Fong

customer_reviews.title: Noisy Fan
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully this fan will quiet down or i will be forced to purchase another one. i should have kept the box and all that it came in and with so i could return it but i assumed it would be quiet like the one it replaced by the same company. i threw the box away so i will just reorder if it doesn't quiet down soon.
customer_reviews.author: deepstep al

customer_reviews.title: Good Function, Not Very Bright Lights
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 fans and they work good. My i7-9700k was running at about 75-80c with Aida64. I only had one fun up on the radiator. I replace the one old fan and put in these 2 and now my temp is about 65-70c. I wish they had clear blades to light up brighter.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: VERY quiet A+++
customer_reviews.text: Needed a simple Blue LED replacement for my several year old existing fan that was rumbling a bit until warmed up. This is dead silent at high performance (pretty much anyway) and for the price, couldn't be happier as fans go. Sure there'sNoctuas and the like but for a cheaper quick fan, this fits the bill just fine. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Faslane Tech

customer_reviews.title: 3 pins
customer_reviews.text: This is listed as a 4 pin connector and it only has 3 pins with an adapter. However, the adapter does not fit into the power supply so this is useless. They have a zero return policy also, but a phone call with Amazon Customer service took care of the refund. They told not to bother returning the item so it is going on the trash.
customer_reviews.author: NMFW

customer_reviews.title: Silent is an overstatement
customer_reviews.text: These fans are not even a little bit silent, there was no noticeable difference between these fans and the ancient ones I replaced. I work from home and customers ask me if I'm driving because of the loud hum of these fans. I bought 6 expecting my office to stop sounding like a data center but it's just as noisy as ever. It doesn't matter when I'm gaming, where software will only broadcast when I'm speaking, but with the always-on VOIP phone it's a constant sound that drives sensitive customers crazy. I'm sure there are louder fans out there but I've been lucky enough to have never had one.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Decent life
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these back in May 2013. First one failed early/mid 2019, now a second one has failed Jan 2020. Pretty good fans overall, will probably go with red or black ones from here on out (blue is pretty bright).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Snow

customer_reviews.title: Not Used In Computer
customer_reviews.text: This fan, which performs very well, was used in a supplemental cooling system for a HF radio amplifier. The placement of the fan alongside the exhaust vent of the amplifier cabinet helps exhaust the hot air from the 572B amplifier tubes by creating a draft. The blue lights proved vey helpful because the fan is operated by its own On/Off switch and the presence of the blue light is a reminder for the operator that the power must be switched off before closing down the station. The 12 volts of power needed for it is provided by a "wall wart" transformer found in our used parts bin. I am very satisfied with the quiet operation and seamless performance.
customer_reviews.author: shirley peschka

customer_reviews.title: Air Flow!
customer_reviews.text: Larger than expected (I thought these fans came in only one size), but I got it to work by putting it on the side of my case where there were air holes. I was having problems with my PC overheating -- particularly from a video utility called Handbrake. My video card said the temperature was 65 degrees Celsius. After using this, the temperature dropped to about 41 degrees Celsius, so obviously, my PC wasn't getting enough air flow. This fan comes with several plug adapters to hook into available plugs coming from your power supply. Just make sure that if you only have one place to install a fan that you measure first.
customer_reviews.author: George M. Regnery

customer_reviews.title: super quiet
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a fan in one of my PC cases here in my studio, so I thought I would give this a try. Not only does it draw the air to move like it should it does look really cool and is ultra quiet. I plan to get more and replace these noisy things I have! LOL
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Killer fan!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to replace the 120mm stock fan in my V8 CPU cooler. After cleaning and installing this new fan, then remounting, I was completely blown away by the results. Even when this cooler was brand new, my i7 CPU idled around 50 degrees celcius. With this new fan, the same cooler (which is now over 6 years old) gives me an idle temp of 38 degrees. And that's WITH minor overclocking enabled! I'm not even sure how this is entirely possible, but the numbers don't lie! This fan also runs pretty much silently as well. I'm going to buy 3 more of these to replace dying case fans.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Snapp

customer_reviews.title: Buy this fan.Quiet,Cool,and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I Have done much to reduce the overall fan noise from my recent build. This fan is absolutely a must buy. I Have the Evo 212 and this fan runs 2000rpm and is almost silent compared to the stock cooler master 2000rpm fan that comes stock with the Evo 212 heatsink. not to mention my CPU runs at 14c. this fan is soo silent at all levels that I had to buy another to replace the stock fan. This thing is fantastic. also the led is dim..in my opinion that is a good thing. Playing at night a bright case lights up like a Christmas tree and distracts from my gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: MANDY GARDNER

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last long
customer_reviews.text: They were nice while they lasted. Kept them clean, the blue was super bright and nice. But Mine didn't last to long they randomly started to spin slowly. Cleaned them but did not fix issue. They joined the old comp parts box haha
customer_reviews.author: Rabb

customer_reviews.title: Low flow, intermittently loud
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed specs say lot of air flow, however Air flow is not very good at all. Probably the weakest fans I have ever bought. One of the two i bought is intermittently loud makes a noise for a time then stops, then starts again. Fan speed is constant wired directly to 1k gold power supply. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Color not quite right.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these to replace the front fans in my Antec 900 case. They ran fine but the color was off. Not exactly what the picture shows. They look blue until they are next to my existing fans and all of my blue LED peripherals. They have a bit of a violet hue. Very close to blue, but off just enough to annoy me every time I looked at them. Decided to return them and pay a bit extra for original, 3-speed Antec fans I found elswhere. If you're not picky about exactly matching the color like I am, they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Haffner

customer_reviews.title: This fan rattles quite loudly while warming up
customer_reviews.text: Fan has become incredibly clanky, rattly, and loud upon start up. The sound can be heard from quite far away and almost sounds like the fan is hitting something (which it isn't based on the look of my set up). But, after 5 to 15 minutes, the fan 'warms up' or something and quiets back down. The fan is still pretty loud (its a large fan) but completely stops its rattling after the warm up period. Don't get this if you are specifically looking for some quiet. I am a little worried that the rattling I hear could mean more problems in the future but so far it's lasted more than 2 months in its current state without getting worse.
customer_reviews.author: Zack M

customer_reviews.title: Cool CPU fan
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Needed a replacement CPU heatsink fan. I have 6 fans to cool my case. Couldn't care less how loud, just that my components keep cool. The last thing I need is a heat related failure.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: They’re very quiet, the airflow is low but that’s to be expected with silent fans. And for my use it’s perfect! I have two of these generating light air circulation in a 3D print enclosure to prevent excesss heat build up, they’re perfect for the job and not to strong to be a threat to the print quality!
customer_reviews.author: FTK

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: It looks good once it’s working, but it was very hard to install. Maybe it was just my case, but the screws were just very thick and it made it harder to screw them in. Other than that, it works, and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not 19DB
customer_reviews.text: I like the fans but they are NOT 19BD. They are 100% for sure louder then 19DB. BUT The fan seemed decent
customer_reviews.author: TheRealDlo

customer_reviews.title: Booya, works great
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. The screws that came with it didn't fit my computer case, but whatever. I just got some machine screws I had leftover in my garage. It came with a power cable converter thingy so I could plug this thing in directly to the power supply. The pins on the larger 4 pronged part were slightly bent I think, so it took an extra minute to get the thing plugged in, but it was fine. Now I can return to my 8 hour MMORPG session without my computer overheating right in the middle of a raid. Better go heat up some hot pockets...
customer_reviews.author: Beavis Comeavis

customer_reviews.title: It works, and is fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.text: It works, and is fairly quiet. Now why did I only give it 3 stars? Mostly, because of the length of the cable. It's too short. My second case fan is an antec Tricool (, and it's cable is an acceptable length. The Antec also has a three-speed switch, which is also nice, and would have been nice on this Cooler Master fan. This fan also doesn't produce nearly as much light as the Antec fan, but some people might prefer this amount. I had to re-arrange my whole case fan setup to accommodate this short cable.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Hertzler

customer_reviews.title: Horrible screaming sound, don't recomment at all.
customer_reviews.text: This fan had such a horrific scream that it could be heard throughout the entire house and was such a terrible tone that I instantly had a severe headache and nearly threw up. The fan only ran for a few minutes before I could no longer handle it even at the opposite end of the house and turned off the computer and removed the fan. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: AGTG2

customer_reviews.title: Good looking fans, but the lifespan is questionable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these to use in a computer case HAF 912 , and they look GREAT and they run ok. Cons: These fans have about a 3-4 yr life span. The bearings in these fans start to go out after about 3 years, and I have since upgraded to a more expensive fan setup. Overall these fans are a "you get what you pay for", eventually these fans will get loud, squeaky and even caused the cpu to thermal throttle once they started to die, so beware if your computer starts to overheat, thats when you know they need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: Too loud at maximum performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these fans to replace the default back intake that came with my Challenger case, and it works wonderfully when plugged into the board. It does not, however, come close to the rated CFM. I liked it so I bought a second one which had to be plugged directly into the power supply - the result was much greater intake, but a ridiculous amount of noise. The bottom line is, this is a fan that does the job, looks nice, and runs super quiet IF you plug it into the motherboard directly or use a fan controller. Unless you are deaf, or want to be, I would never recommend plugging it directly into the supply.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cool Master sickle flow 120mm...Works great... and quiet..... What more can one ask for...There are some claiming these are noisy but im sure they are running them full speed and i did see a little what their talking about... So i hooked mine directly to mother board instead to slow it down a bit and all is great and still good air flow...
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: They didn't last long, and became VERY noisy after only a little while. The LEDs also flickered alot after they started failing. Looked good while they worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia S.

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have had this fan in one of my computers for over a year and it still works well. I Have had good experiences with Cooler Master products in they past this is no exception. Pros: good price , moves a nice volume of air for its size, light is a nice accent inside the case. Cons : noise it is a bit loud at full speed, this was not a deal breaker for me as the tower does not sit on the desktop in my application. Overall : great performance for the price, seems durable , a bit noisy if your tower is close to your head level.
customer_reviews.author: J. H

customer_reviews.title: good fan overall so far
customer_reviews.text: nice and quiet. be warned however that the image of the fan that is with this product is exactly how the led light looks. I assumed that the light would be more uniformly spread and that the image just "caught" the light's reflection during the rotation. that is not the case. I haven't examined the fan but it looks like the led's are fixed and have this plastic tube for the led light to travel down to create the static pattern. It's a concentrated design like the picture. I like mine just fine but don't let it suprise you if you're looking for something more spread out. Will try to post back if it dies earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: maxpowers

customer_reviews.title: ... Cooler Master SickleFlow 120 LED Fans seem to be good all purpose case fans
customer_reviews.text: The Cooler Master SickleFlow 120 LED Fans seem to be good all purpose case fans. While they are rated to turn at 2000 rpm, they are very quiet at speed. As a consequence to the fan running so quietly, it also does not move a great deal of air either. The blue LED lighting is attractive, (for those that like it), and I have no reason to believe that the fans will last a long time. Again, these are quiet running, but they do not move a lot of air.
customer_reviews.author: Antony Steele

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised. This is not a 4 pin case fan. It is a 2 pin single speed fan that is not controlled by the board. It has a three pin connector of which the last pin in the connector is blank. I don't who is answering questions for this device, either they don't know what they are talking about or the manufacturer is shipping multiple products. If the fan speed is advertised as up to 69.69 CFM that implies to me that the speed is variable. If you are just looking for a single speed fan for your box it is a nice unit, definitely quite and the led is bright.
customer_reviews.author: LAM

customer_reviews.title: Good fan for the price
customer_reviews.text: It does cool down the pc and circulate the air. I used this for the backside of my PC for a while now. The only thing I don't like is the noise. My previous fan was the silent type so this is noticeablely louder. So a matter of preference, I would not buy it again. I bought two during this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hoai N.

customer_reviews.title: Silent??
customer_reviews.text: These fans are anything BUT silent, they look great, nice and sleek, push a lot of air but are very noticeably on with a hummmmmm and buzzz sound. Relaxes my birds as they like background sounds, but not something I would have bought if I would have known. If you like background noise, then these are for you. If you prefer quiet fans, look elsewhere. 3/29/14 update: They seem to have gotten louder, it is to the point that it seems my computer is getting ready for take off, I can't deal with it any more-they are going back!
customer_reviews.author: NAP21

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: TBH all fans of this type are easy to install. This one in particular is very quiet. I bought this for the low price, but the blue LEDs are a nice touch, even if I never see them (this fan is on the back of my computer case). Happy I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: robotfan

customer_reviews.title: effective and quiet cooling, terrible illumination
customer_reviews.text: These fans are remarkably cool and quiet fans though, even as it approaches their max RPM/CFM. However, the clear fan blades cause the LED to only show up as curved lines, not an illuminated fan. It's really dim color. I mostly care about the cooling efficiency so, it's not a big deal to me, but others should beware.
customer_reviews.author: Tangent Tina

customer_reviews.title: Provides good air flow but very loud
customer_reviews.text: To start since they pool all reviews together for all the fans this is for theIt does work and it seems to work fairly well in terms of air flow but I do want to say that the fan is anything but silent as the page says, its loud enough that every time I boot my computer now my wife says it is time for lift off. All in all I think it is a decent fan so far aside from the noise. If you have no concerns about very loud fans I think they will suit your needs. I will continue using the ones I purchased (4 of them) but I will look for a quieter alternative next time.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Makes my PC sound like its under full load
customer_reviews.text: Well, they have Blue LED lights & they definitely move a LOT of air... A little too much I feel. They are quite loud at their stock RPMs. Makes my PC sound like its under full load, even when its just idle or I'm browsing the web. The LEDs are also considerably duller than I expected. I almost thought the lights weren't turning on at first. (Some people may appreciate a dull blue instead of a super bright luminescence Blue). Overall, if you only care about strong cooling & want some blue in your case: These are ok for their price. I would NOT recommend these if you want a quiet system though.
customer_reviews.author: red ghost

customer_reviews.title: Noisy Fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is advertised as "Silent" and it is louder than all of my other three case fans combined even when set to lowest flow with a fan controller. It doesn't just whine, it also has a bit of a rattle or scraping sound. Despite all of the reviews think twice before purchasing this loud cheap sounding fan. I give Amazon 5-stars for taking care of my problem less than 6-hrs after I reported it!
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Blue LED 120mm Sickleflow
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that this is a great little fan. i have 1 of these hooked into my case fan control switch on the NZXT Phantom 410 Chassis and this little fan moves some air! It does make a little bit of noise but it doesn't bother me. i also tested the top speed on it and it managed to pull off 2300rpm @ 100% power. and around 1200rpm @ about 50% power. it uses 3 pins on it's power connector. i have ordered more and Highly recommend them. Update: 12/31/13 i ordered 3 more fans (1 blue LED and 2 Red LED) and none DOA and they all keep my system running cool
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: great fan!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working really well! Came with an adapter cord so I can plug it in to my power source directly which made it really nice.This might be the best fan in my system (which might not be saying much), but my temps are much lower now. I actually drilled out holes for this fan on top of my computer (in a safe place) which made a huge difference. Cleaning wasn't helping enough, but this fan on the inside top of my computer did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: i have 3 of these in my case and the LEDs are basically invisible
customer_reviews.text: My CPU fan (the prism wraith cooler that came with my AMD Ryzen 2700X) is a million times prettier and brighter, as are my RGB RAM and the RGB on my Nvidia GeForce GTX 1070ti also is 100% brighter than these fans.
customer_reviews.author: huskersgirllaura

customer_reviews.title: Not a quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: The fan I received was in no way quiet. It was louder than everything else in my case. I bought a Cooler Master 200mm fan also and it was much much quieter. I am not sure if they hit a bad batch at some point or not but others have been saying this too. I wouldn't recommend this fan if you are looking for something with no noise. I boughta different, more expensive fan to replace this one and it is actually silent. The fan looks really good and pushed a lot of air. The one I replaced it with didn't have LED and I miss that. If you don't mind some noise it would be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Noend

customer_reviews.title: Moves a lot of air. Loud though.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this fan for a couple years and bought it because of the blue LEDs. It seems to move massive amounts of air, but I finally unplugged it because it is actually quite loud. I couldn't stand the noise as I began working on my desktop more. Its great for cooling, but keep in mind that it does get loud.
customer_reviews.author: HackMATTr

customer_reviews.title: 120mm Fan Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the “Raidmax Super Blade Case”. 120mm fan, installed it to the front of my case. Fit pretty well, no issues really screwing it in. As for noise, not super loud but definitely noticeable when it kicks into gear when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: This is not a cpu fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan because in its description it said it was a 4pin fan for coolers like the cooler master v6 and v8. I have a v8. This is a case fan with a 3 pin for motherboard or converter to 4 pin for power supply. This is not a 4 pin cpu fan for motherboard and speed control. You need to fix your description. I kept the fan as a spare 120 case fan. Disappointed it did not solve the issue I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Ragon

customer_reviews.title: Good fan, but...
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a good quality fan, but maybe my idea of silent is different than Cooler Masters. It could very well be that I had too high of expectations for the level of "silence" I would get from this, that lead to my slight disappointment. It could also be that it was put in to a cheap case. Either way, I was hoping for not being able to hear much of anything when paired with another one of Cooler Master's Silent Series fans, but it definitely was not silent. Not unhappy with the purchase, just not as happy with the noise level as I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan, power lead too short.
customer_reviews.text: The fans were needed to replace some fans that had failed in my case. They went in fine, but one thing of notice is the power lead is fairly short. I was not able to just put them in the old locations. After reconfiguring the other fans, they do work fine. They were a little louder than I had imagined, but my main complaint is the short power leads.
customer_reviews.author: D. French

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: All I can do is hope it lasts a week or two. I sprayed it down good. Hell you never know what your going to get, when it is from CHINA.
customer_reviews.author: pitbullman216

customer_reviews.title: Cooler Master SickleFlow 120 - Sleeve Bearing 120mm Blue LED Silent Fan for Computer Cases
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet and easy to install. I put these on the front and side panel of my new computer system. Good price and if I need more I will purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: Hammercl

customer_reviews.title: provides good air
customer_reviews.text: this replaces a previous one i bought that failed after some time. i bought about 4 in late 2013. that was the only one that failed. the light stopped and also the fan. it was wobbly and loose. however, i believe i got my money's worth. they provide good air and blue light to my system and are not very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Works fine when mounted vertically.
customer_reviews.text: This fan is affordably priced and available in several attractive (to some) colors. The actual airflow from mine seems to be fairly strong and the fan is pretty quiet when installed properly. By properly, I mean that the fan needs to be mounted vertically, or else it will make plenty of noise (even when using the noise isolators that came with the computer case). I read online that this is due to the sleeve bearing. Keep in mind that depending on your motherboard, you may not be able to run this fan at less than 50% of the maximum rpm unless you use a CPU fan header on the motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: patrkcirtap

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: For such a reasonable price this is a great product for my gaming system. Running at 2000 rpms its nice and quiet, functioning as the only exhaust fan it keeps my system at 77 degrees even when playing high demanding games. That says alot when u add the fact I live in the western Texas desert in a room with poor airflow. Installation was a snap for someone of limited tech experience and the LED look is stellar.
customer_reviews.author: Null ARC 17

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found this Cooler Master Fan sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Last few fans haven't provided the cooling needed or lasted very long. This one seems to be just what my case needed. The Good: Quiet - You can hear it but not a jet engine like other models I have tried. Provides a nice amount of air movement Lowered CPU temp by a good 10 degrees Light output not overly bright that it's annoying Cons: No fan grill included but for the price that's fine. Overall great performance. For $10 it was just what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Finn

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Pushes air as described, little to no sound coming from these fans. Easily twice to three times more air than the fans that came with my server case which are documented at 30ish CFM (if I believe it). I don't have a tool to precisely measure CFM or some other standard.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Gere

customer_reviews.title: It’s a fan that sounds like a vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: My fan was making a grinding noise, so I bought a new fan to escape the noise. Now, my computer sounds like a loud vacuum cleaner because of this fan. I can cover my computer a little to muffle some of the noise. I guess it’s loud because it’s super fast, but unfortunately I don’t have the ability to turn down the fan speed.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to work in tandem with the fan already installed on the side of my computer case and it has definitely made a difference. I repurposed a workstation into a server and airflow, at times, was a bit of an issue. There was an open spot for another fan, so I got this one to fill the slot. The only thing I don't like is the slight bit of increased noise, but that's an acceptable trade-off for increased airflow. Next server I build, I'll probably opt for a liquid cooling solution, but for now, this fan helps out a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Isma'il

customer_reviews.title: NOISY, LOUD = JUNK
customer_reviews.text: After about a month of use these fans become very noisy. This is my second fan as the first one had to be thrown away it was making so much noise. The second one is on its way to the trash can as I am sure the noise will become unbearable. Seems the bearings are the culprit as they are the usual cheap crap made in China. I would buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: CSP

customer_reviews.title: Solid three year run.
customer_reviews.text: This fan had a good run. I've owned it since 2013 and it has worked great until recently. Now it makes a noise similar to that of shuffling a deck of cards. Either way, it's a $10 fan that had a three year life. I'll probably still buy another one. The other fans I bought are the 200mm Cooler Master Mega Flow fans and they're still silent as a whisper. I'd recommend this fan to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Good fan
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this for a different project, but my needs changed so I decided to throw it in the computer. Easy to hookup, 4-prong just hanging there off my power supply. I used some adhesive magnet on the corner to make it stick to the side that slides off for access. Now it creates positive pressure so the other four vents don't get clogged anymore, I just have to wipe the one "in" zone with the fan now. and the light looks awesome of course. Pretty quiet too, barely hear it, and my pc is on the desk, not under a cupboard or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Keeton K Fagnani

customer_reviews.title: THE RATTLING! THE HORRIBLE RATTLING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These fans are HORRIBLE! I have 3 attached to a 360mm radiator on the top of my case. First the center fan started to rattle, now the left and center are rattling and driving me crazy! Dont cheap out, buy better fans. The noise goes away if you push the center of the fan inward. Cheap junk.
customer_reviews.author: mike k

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but cable are short
customer_reviews.text: One of my case fans were make some noise now after 2 years of use. These fans are quiet. I wished to get the ones without any light but they were more expensive then the blue (odd). But whatever, they do the job. I ran into one issue with these and it was because the cable weren't as long. I could use the extra cable to convert 3 to 4 but this was suppose to hook up to the cpu cooler (using 3 pin) since it control the fan speed.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Not just for PC use.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful fans push a good amount of air and aren't extremely loud. LED lights are a little dimmer than I'd like but overall great product. Used these in an entertainment center I built to push/pull air past and away from my consoles. In the pictures these were in the bottom 4 cubbies and the top two were Cooler Master CM Essentials 140, which were clear plastic and much brighter.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: These fans are easily installed, the LED lighting is a nice addition ...
customer_reviews.text: These fans are easily installed, the LED lighting is a nice addition and they move plenty of air however, they are not quiet. In fact, after installing two of them it took a couple of days to get used to the increased noise from the fans. They fit perfectly in the top of my Cooler Master PC case and the wires are long enough to reach a power source.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: About three months after installing on the top of the ...
customer_reviews.text: About three months after installing on the top of the case it began to show signs of wearing down or having some sort of manufacture fault. The fan must have been off balance and began to rattle and required me to tap the fan until it stopped. Same thing happened with another fan and that fan eventually just fell apart. So I have just taken the fan out. Not to mention it is loud. Two stars because it does move air quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Maria S.

customer_reviews.title: Loudest fan I have ever had!!
customer_reviews.text: Loud and I mean very loud, sound like a vacuum cleaner running, I absolutely hate it and will be replacing this ASAP! This is not silent running as advertised, what a joke! Everyone in the house can hear it, high pitched and annoying to say the least!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this product.
customer_reviews.text: This fan works flawlessly, the color makes my gaming tower look so much better while keeping it very cool, the fan noise is minimal I honestly don't even notice it unless I focus on it. If you're looking for a good cooling fan that also works to enhance your setups look at a good pricepoint, then look no more and get this one, working perfectly after several months of much use.
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I had to return one of the two fans I received, it was hovering at around 1200rpm and it was really distracting due to the noise. I am running an intake fan on the front and another on the side of my case and they both run great now. The intake on the front runs constant at 1850rpm and its slightly audible, but you won't notice it for long. The fans have decent air flow and the LED's are not super bright, just the right amount without being distracting. Over-all happy with them both, I may get a third in the future for another exhaust fan
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, runs very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: First time buying a case fan. Have a run of the mill desktop with a GeForce 8500GT (passive cooling - no fan). Got this to keep the case a little cooler and help cool down the GPU. Dropped the case temp by nearly 10°C. Keep in mind i only had one 92mm exhaust fan before, neglecting the power supplies fan. Very satisfied. Also, a lot of the user pictures show the fan as exhausts. That is why the lighting doesn't look like the default image. If you have the fan blowing into the case, it looks very similar to the default image, which is cool, but can be bright when the lights are off.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this is cool
customer_reviews.text: Built a system in Sept '10 and used two of these coolers for the first time and a third cheaper cooler. After 3 months, the other cooler gave up. But the cooler Master running silently and it seems they will run forever. Replaced the cheaper cooler with on of this and my system is breathing right again! You always look for one brand that is solid and even after the manufacturere retire that product you still look for it and wish it will never be replaced - well, this is one those solid items. Compared to other similar products, price is good, could be a little cheaper though.
customer_reviews.author: M. Khan

customer_reviews.title: Louder than most reviews say
customer_reviews.text: I know there's no fans that capture true silence but these talked a big game in the reviews like I'd never know they are there but truth is after installing 4 in my case it sounds a bit loud. Now I know that's a lot of fans but but I just had higher expectations. The positive is, this is a GREAT white noise sound permeating from my tower now that keeps my mind at ease while I'm trolling all my blog sites.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Clouse

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Replaced one with a speed control, which I do not need. I don't need the blue light, either, but it is (at least) a power indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Kanabal

customer_reviews.title: Blue LEDs are actually purple
customer_reviews.text: Love the fan itself, but I don't care much for the fact that the blue LED fan I ordered is actually purple. Can't really tell in the picture but my wife came into the office and asked why I ordered a purple fan. I bought two of these and haven't installed the second one so I don't know how it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Works but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new 120mm fan for the top of PC case, and this seemed like a popular fan to buy. I'd have to say that the fan worked well. It can push a lot of air and the blue led lights matched my led light s on my case! The fan was very loud though when i spun it at full speed. Additionally, there was a rattling sound probably caused by loose bearings. I had to fix it with some tape to weight it down. It's a good fan, just don't expect it to be quiet!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Lim

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: The LEDs are not that bright or noticeable like in the pictures, and they are LOUD AS S***!!! Like seriously if you're a YouTuber or even like using your mic period, you either need to have this under your desk, or be using a condenser microphone, which thankfully I have one. I recommend the Audio Technica ATR2500. Good mic. Oh, I'm getting off topic here, anyways the fans are pretty cool, both in looks and temp, and are pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: erypto

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: This fan is NOT quite. Makes a very high pitch noise. I’m trying to get use to it but might have to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mayor

customer_reviews.title: 120mm Cooler Master SickleFlow fan
customer_reviews.text: Love this fan!!! I modified/rigged it in my iMac G3. Very silent fan at 19dba!!!! A 69CFM rating lots of air flow. Highly recommend getting one!!!! Plus I didn't realized it had blue LEDs, which look good!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchlovin

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how to rate warmth for a computer case fan. 5 stars of 1 star. doesn't get hot but cools the case, you decide the warmth
customer_reviews.author: BimmerJim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Air Flow! Super Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I was happily surprised when i felt the air flow of this fan! It is says that this fan has only 69 CFM, but I think it's way more than that. This fan has amazing air pressure and it is an amazing radiator/heatsink fan. This fan also looks nice with smoked fan blades and blue led and it gives an amazing effect of curved blue lines going into the middle of the fan unlike some other fans with the led light just spreading everywhere. The best part of this fan is that it is only $5! This is probably the best cheap fan you can find anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Jessy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I use this fan to dump hot air from my stereo cabinet out to keep the components cool. I use it in conjunction with a molex adapter  to power it (using a DC fan keeps it quieter than an AC fan). Fan broke in less than a year, called up the MFR, they had me break the fan physically, take pictures, and then they mailed me out a new fan, no charge to me. Had they not made it right, I would have given a much lower rating, but solving a problem well when it arises is much more important than never having a problem.
customer_reviews.author: James White

product_meta.title: Cooler Master SickleFlow 120 - Sleeve Bearing 120mm Blue LED Silent Fan for Computer Cases, CPU Coolers, and Radiators
product_meta.description:
Style:SickleFlow 120 Blue| Color:BlueCooler Master R4-L2R-20AC-GP 120mm Blue LED Case Fan

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer
feature_bullets: 19 dB-A silent application for CPU cooling
RoHS compliance for protecting the environment
Recommended for V10, V8, Hyper 212, Hyper Z600, Gemini, Cosmos, Cosmos S, Haf 932, HAF 922, CM Storm Scout and Sniper

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,295 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
